Proposed Change:
Clarify references to and descriptions of booleans throughout the Standard.
For example, change the terms 'process flag' and 'boolean flag' to 'flag'.
Rationale: To increase consistency across the Standard.

Proposed Change: Reformat logic statements in the Standard.
Rationale: To increase clarity across the Standard.

Proposed Change: Add rules for revised budgets. The IATI Standard currently allows multiple versions of a revised budget to be published for the same time period.
Rationale: Data users should be able to sum the budget figures to get totals for a country or region.
Source:
"Evidence for a Major Upgrade"

Previous secretariat research

Rationale: Budget type and status are not mandatory, so it can be hard for a data user to know whether a budget is indicative/committed or original/revised. As 2 item codelists, a boolean could meet this need.

Proposed Change: Add a budget-line element to the Activity Standard, as in the `Organisation Standard <https://iatistandard.org/en/iati-standard/203/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/>`_ .
Rationale: To allow linkage between organisation and activity level budget lines.
Source: Requested by IATI Community Member, Oct 2023

Proposed Change: Remove the country-budget-items element from the Standard.
Rationale: Element is redundant, superseded by the `sector codes <https://iatistandard.org/en/iati-standard/203/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/sector/>`_ .
Source:
Initial `discussions <https://www.iaticonnect.org/group/standard-management-consultations-0/discussion/guidance-implementing-aid-and-budget-alignment>`_ in 2017.

"Standardising the Standard"

Previous secretariat research

Proposed Change: Add rules to require that activity status and dates must align.
Rationale: Tools and data users struggle to categorise activities, as often the status doesn't match the dates.
Source:
"Standardising the Standard"

Previous secretariat research

`State of the Data 3:  Timeliness <https://deepnote.com/streamlit-apps/60103a9d-7316-4528-b0fb-12beead3e967>`_

Proposed Change: Clarify Rule 7.8.1: "The activity should specify a default currency OR the currency must be specified for each monetary value."
Rationale:
The `transaction example usage <https://iatistandard.org/en/iati-standard/203/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/value//>`_ specifies that "A Currency code should only be declared if different to @default-currency in the iati-activity element." 

This is contradictory and confusing for reporting organisations.

Proposed Change: Remove the document-link elements from result, indicator, and baseline elements.
Rationale: Less than 1% of document-links are published here, including ""Results, outcomes and outputs" documents.
Source: `State of the Data 1: Document Links in an AI Era <https://deepnote.com/streamlit-apps/dd5a3dfc-3703-4a70-9f2a-b08fe26e391e>`_

Proposed Change: Change the description from "A date/time stamp for when this file was generated..." to "A date/time when this file was generated...".
Rationale: To increase consistency across the Standard.

Proposed Change: Update the definition to declare that they are case insensitive.
Rationale: To simplify analysis of IATI data, and avoid mis-matches due to case.

Proposed Change: Change Rule 1.3.1: "The iati-identifier should not start or end with spaces or newlines." to "The iati-identifier must not start or end with spaces or newlines."
Rationale: Identifiers that start or end with spaces or newlines are likely to cause processing issues for data users.

Proposed Change: Combine the point and pos elements.
Rationale: The point element only contains one set attribute which could move to pos or to the element description.

Proposed Change: Change description from "...it if STRONGLY RECOMMENDED..." to "...it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED...".
Clarify that related-activities should refer to activities from the same reporting organisation.
Rationale: To ensure consistent use and understanding of the Standard.

Proposed Change: Clarify references to narrative content in the definition: 'The narrative content may contain text (e.g. 2011Q1) for accurately recording less specific dates such as month, quarter, or year."
Rationale: This implies that the transaction-date element has narrative content, which is not the case.

Proposed Change: Replace the term 'IATI specification' with 'IATI Standard'
Rationale: To increase consistency across the Standard.
To increase consistency across the Standard.

Proposed Change: Change definition from "...While this is an optional field it is strongly recommended..." to "...This is an optional field, but it is strongly recommended...".
Rationale: To increase clarity across the Standard.
